result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Allan Zak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation September 11, 2015 by 4:30 p.m.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: James Robert Bartholomew DF: Kenneth Allan Zak appeared. Case called at 3:06. Includes 15CF56, 15CF50, 14CF528. ADA Hartung updates the court, there is a DJOC on Ct.1 in 14CF528. Atty. Bartholomew agrees and responds.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 misdemeanor bail jumping in 15CF50 and Ct. 1 in 14CF528. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CF528 and withhold conviction and guilty of Ct 1 in 151CF50. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF528 and 15CF56. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 
On 15CF50 
1 year probation with conditions
- Costs and costs of supervision.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Follow any recommended treatment
- Outstanding costs for testing $45.38.

  Apply bond on 14CF528 file. DE to sign up for probation by 4:30 tomorrow.
Plea hearing at 09-10-2015 03:00 pm

**AMENDED**

Includes 14CF528, 15CF50 and 15CF56

-Bond on file.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing every Sat. by 5:00pm to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

- DE to maintain treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: James Robert Bartholomew DF: Kenneth Alan Zak appeared. Case called at 10:08. Includes 14CF528, 15CF50, 15CF56. Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 11:30 am.

We don't need a new bond we will just send a copy of the minutes to the jail.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
